City Events

  1. City of Iowa Colony Parade Entry Form 2026

    The City of Iowa Colony is accepting parade entry submissions for the 2026 event. Participants may register a group or organization and... More… The City of Iowa Colony is accepting parade entry submissions for the 2026 event. Participants may register a group or organization and indicate whether they are entering a float or vehicle, along with providing a designated driver’s name and contact information. The parade will take place on Saturday, January 17, 2026. All floats and vehicles must arrive fully decorated at the Iowa Colony Public Building for lineup between 8:30 AM and 9:30 AM. The parade will begin promptly at 10:00 AM. The parade route will start at 3144 Meridiana Parkway, travel along Meridiana Parkway to Iowa Colony Boulevard, then turn right and continue until reaching Freedom Field Stadium. Upon arrival, participants will park and proceed into the Alumni Building for the Mini-MLK Program. Less…

  1. Development Review Committee

    More… The Development Review Committee (DRC) provides a forum for developers, property owners, and representatives to discuss predevelopment questions with City staff. Meetings are scheduled on a first-come, first-served basis, held in 30-minute increments, with up to four appointments per date. The first meeting is provided at no cost; additional meetings are billed per the City’s fee schedule (Ordinance 2019-28). DRC meetings occur every other Tuesday from 9:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. Applicants use this form to provide contact details, describe the proposed work (commercial, residential, or subdivision), and upload documents such as surveys, site plans, drainage plans, or plats. Submission does not guarantee placement; all information and documents must be received by the posted deadline. Less…

  1. Public Information Request

    More… The Public Information Request section allows citizens to submit requests for access to government records under the Texas Public Information Act (Texas Government Code § 552). Through this form, requestors may specify the documents they wish to inspect or obtain, attach supporting files if needed, and select their preferred method of delivery (in-person inspection, mail, or email). Required fields ensure accurate processing, including contact details and a detailed description of the records sought. The City of Iowa Colony will respond to requests in compliance with the Public Information Act, which may involve review by the Texas Attorney General to determine confidentiality. This process promotes transparency while protecting sensitive information as required by law. Less…

Mayor

  1. Mayoral Attendance Request

    The Mayoral Attendance Request form allows individuals, businesses, and organizations to formally invite the Mayor to participate in... More… The Mayoral Attendance Request form allows individuals, businesses, and organizations to formally invite the Mayor to participate in community events, grand openings, ceremonies, and celebrations. Requestors provide event details such as date, time, location, purpose, and the Mayor’s expected role, as well as contact information for the day of the event. Supporting materials, agendas, or speaking points may also be uploaded for review. Submitting this form ensures the Mayor’s Office receives the necessary information to consider the request and coordinate attendance. Less…

  1. Mayoral Proclamation Request

    More… The Mayoral Proclamation Request section provides a way for residents, organizations, and community groups to request formal recognition from the Mayor of Iowa Colony. Proclamations highlight the importance of local events, honor individual or group achievements, or acknowledge Iowa Colony’s participation in significant national observances. Requests must include a detailed purpose statement (minimum 300 words), submitted in either paragraph or “whereas” format, and should be made at least two weeks in advance to allow for processing. Applicants may also indicate if the Mayor’s presence is requested at the presentation and select their preferred method of delivery. This form ensures all required contact information is collected and provides an option to upload a draft proclamation for review. Less…

  1. Lions Ball Park Reservations

    More… The Lions Ball Park Reservations form allows individuals and organizations to reserve baseball fields at the Manvel/Iowa Colony Lions Club facility. Reservations must be submitted at least one week in advance and may be made for single-day use, season use, or extended play. Fees vary based on residency status, reservation type, and duration, with additional deposits for water keys and bases if needed. Applicants provide contact information, estimated attendance, and indicate whether 85% or more participants are Iowa Colony residents. By submitting the form, users agree to park rules, including no play after dark and prompt reporting of damage or maintenance issues. Less…

  1. Park Facilities Reservations

    The Park Facilities Reservations form allows residents and organizations to reserve City parks for events. Groups under 25 attendees do... More… The Park Facilities Reservations form allows residents and organizations to reserve City parks for events. Groups under 25 attendees do not require a permit; groups of 25–75 require a $50 permit, while groups over 75 require a $50 permit plus $80 per hour for mandatory law enforcement services. Any event where alcohol is served, regardless of size, must have two Iowa Colony police officers present. Reservations may be paused or canceled due to inclement weather. Applicants provide event details, contact information, and an e-signature confirming agreement to park rules, including no use after dark and prompt reporting of damage or maintenance issues. Less…

  1. Maintenance Request Form

    More… The Maintenance Request form provides residents with a simple way to report issues or request service for facilities and rights-of-way maintained by the City of Iowa Colony’s Public Works Department. Common request types include pothole repair, street or traffic sign replacement, sidewalk repair, tree trimming, ditch cleaning, streetlight outages, mowing, park equipment concerns, and restroom issues. Requests outside city limits but within the ETJ should be directed to Brazoria County. Residents can include contact information, describe the issue, and upload photos to help staff quickly identify and address the problem. Less…
